title: Debian package dependency issue with python3-github
body:
`python3-github` is recommended by `python3-datalad` and is installed on this Debian buster machine:

```
% apt-cache policy python3-github
python3-github:
  Installed: 1.43.7-1~nd100+1
  Candidate: 1.43.7-1~nd100+1
  Version table:
 *** 1.43.7-1~nd100+1 500
        500 http://neurodebian.mirror.htc.inm7.de/debian buster/main amd64 Packages
        100 /var/lib/dpkg/status
     1.40-1 500
        500 http://debian.mirror.htc.inm7.de/debian buster/main amd64 Packages
```

but it is not functional

```
mih@juseless ~ % python3 -c "import github"
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<string>", line 1, in <module>
  File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/github/__init__.py", line 42, in <module>
    from github.MainClass import Github, GithubIntegration
  File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/github/MainClass.py", line 74, in <module>
    from . import RateLimit
  File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/github/RateLimit.py", line 33, in <module>
    from deprecated import deprecated
ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'deprecated'
```

and this leads to

```
% datalad create-sibling-github some
[ERROR  ] PyGitHub is missing. GitHub-related functionality is unavailable without this package [github_.py:<module>:35] (MissingExternalDependency) 
```

which is an invalid interpretation of the situation.

Installing `python3-deprecated` manually resolves the issue.

I have not yet filed a bug against the `python3-github` Debian package, because this is a NeuroDebian backport, and may just be our bug.
